instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay runs a ForLoop from 0 to 9 and prints the index each iteration.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ForLoopPrint
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=9]
NODE n3: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.InString [String]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ForLoop
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop
NODE n3: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.InString [String] {
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ForLoop
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop
NODE n3: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.InString [String] {

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay uses a ForLoop 0 to 4 to spawn 5 actors in a row, each 200 units apart on the X axis.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_RowSpawner
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=4]
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=200.0]
NODE n4: MakeVector [Y=0, Z=0]
NODE n5: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Item]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.X [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.SpawnTransform [Transform]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SpawnRow
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=4]
NODE n3: GetActorLocation
NODE n4: MultiplyFloat [B=200.0]
NODE n5: AddActorLocalOffset [DeltaLocation=(X=0,Y=0,Z=0)]
NODE n6: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Pawn]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n6.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n4.A [Int]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.DeltaLocation.X [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n5.Target [Actor]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.SpawnTransform [Transform]>
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SpawnRow
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=4]
NODE n3: GetActorLocation
NODE n4: MultiplyFloat [B=200.0]
NODE n5: AddActorLocalOffset [DeltaLocation=(X=0,Y=0,Z=0)]
NODE n6: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Pawn]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n6.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n4.A [Int]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.DeltaLocation.X [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n5.Target [Actor]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.SpawnTransform [Transform]>

instruction: Create a Blueprint with integer Count at 0. On BeginPlay use a WhileLoop while Count less than 5 to increment and print Count.

NODE n2: WhileLoop
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=Count]
NODE n4: LessThan [B=5]
NODE n5: VariableGet [VarName=Count]
NODE n6: AddInt [B=1]
NODE n7: VariableSet [VarName=Count]
NODE n8: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA n3.Value -> n4.A [Int]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n2.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n7.Execute
DATA n5.Value -> n6.A [Int]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.Value [Int]
EXEC n7.Then -> n8.Execute
DATA n7.Value -> n8.InString [String]

EXEC n7.Then -> n8.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint that loops 0 to 19. For each index check if even using modulo. If even print the index.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_EvenPrinter
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=19]
NODE n3: Modulo [B=2]
NODE n4: EqualEqual [B=0]
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.A [Int]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Int]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n6.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n6.InString [String]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_EvenNumbers
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=19]
NODE n3: Modulo [B=2]
NODE n4: EqualEqual [B=0]
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.True -> n6.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.A [Int]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Int]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
DATA n2.Index -> n6.InString [String] }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_EvenNumbers
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=19]
NODE n3: Modulo [B=2]
NODE n4: EqualEqual [B=0]
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.True -> n6.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.A [Int]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Int]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
DATA n2.Index -> n6.InString [String] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint with actor array Targets. On pressing Fire, ForEachLoop destroys all targets then prints All Destroyed.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DestroyAll
PARENT: Actor
VAR Targets: Array<Actor>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Fire"]
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Targets]
NODE n3: ForEachLoop
NODE n4: DestroyActor
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="All Destroyed"]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.Target [Actor]
EXEC n3.Completed -> n5.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DestroyAll
PARENT: Actor
VAR Targets: Array<Actor>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Fire"]
NODE n2: ForEachLoop
NODE n3: DestroyActor
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="All Destroyed"]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.Completed -> n4.Execute
DATA Targets -> n2.Array [Array]
DATA n2.LoopValue -> n3.Target [Actor]);
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DestroyAll
PARENT: Actor
VAR Targets: Array<Actor>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Fire"]
NODE n2: ForEachLoop
NODE n3: DestroyActor
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="All Destroyed"]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.Completed -> n4.Execute
DATA Targets -> n2.Array [Array]
DATA n2.LoopValue -> n3.Target [Actor]);

validation.error:
Line 0: Found 1 parse errors:
Line 12: Invalid DATA syntax | 'DATA Targets -> n2.Array [Array]' | ''

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay uses two nested ForLoops 0 to 2 to spawn actors in a 3x3 grid with 100 unit spacing.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_GridSpawner
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=2]
NODE n3: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=2]
NODE n4: MultiplyFloat [B=100.0]
NODE n5: MultiplyFloat [B=100.0]
NODE n6: MakeVector [Z=0]
NODE n7: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Tile]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n7.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n3.Index -> n5.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n6.X [Float]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Y [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.SpawnTransform [Transform]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_GridSpawner
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Gameplay
GRAPH: EventGraph
VAR GridSize: Int = 3
VAR Spacing: Float = 100.0
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=GridSize]
NODE n3: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=GridSize]
NODE n4: GetActorLocation
NODE n5: MakeVector [X=Spacing, Y=Spacing, Z=0.0]
NODE n6: MultiplyFloat [B=Spacing]
NODE n7: AddActor [SpawnClass=BP_DemoProp]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n6.A [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n5.X [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n5.Y [Float]
DATA n3.Index -> n6.A [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n4.X [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n4.Y [Float]
EXEC n4.Then -> n7.Execute
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n7.SpawnTransform [Transform] {
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_GridSpawner
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Gameplay
GRAPH: EventGraph
VAR GridSize: Int = 3
VAR Spacing: Float = 100.0
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=GridSize]
NODE n3: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=GridSize]
NODE n4: GetActorLocation
NODE n5: MakeVector [X=Spacing, Y=Spacing, Z=0.0]
NODE n6: MultiplyFloat [B=Spacing]
NODE n7: AddActor [SpawnClass=BP_DemoProp]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n6.A [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n5.X [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n5.Y [Float]
DATA n3.Index -> n6.A [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n4.X [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n4.Y [Float]
EXEC n4.Then -> n7.Execute
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n7.SpawnTransform [Transform] {

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay runs ForLoop 1 to 3 printing each index. After the loop waits 2 seconds then prints Done.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_LoopThenWait
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=1, LastIndex=3]
NODE n3: PrintString
NODE n4: Delay [Duration=2.0]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Done"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.InString [String]
EXEC n2.Completed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Completed -> n5.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DelayedForLoop
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=1, LastIndex=3]
NODE n3: PrintString
NODE n4: Delay [Duration=2.0]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Done"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.InString [String]
EXEC n2.Completed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Completed -> n5.Execute }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DelayedForLoop
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=1, LastIndex=3]
NODE n3: PrintString
NODE n4: Delay [Duration=2.0]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Done"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.InString [String]
EXEC n2.Completed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Completed -> n5.Execute }

DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.Value [Float]

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay loops 10 times. Each iteration generates random X and Y within 1000 units and spawns an actor there.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_RandomSpawner
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=9]
NODE n3: RandomFloat [Min=-1000, Max=1000]
NODE n4: RandomFloat [Min=-1000, Max=1000]
NODE n5: MakeVector [Z=0]
NODE n6: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Item]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n6.Execute
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n5.X [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Y [Float]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.SpawnTransform [Transform]
actual_dsl:

instruction: Create a Blueprint with float Health at 100. Use WhileLoop while Health > 0. Each iteration subtract random 1-20 and print Health.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DamageLoop
PARENT: Actor
VAR Health: Float = 100.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: WhileLoop
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=Health]
NODE n4: GreaterThan [B=0.0]
NODE n5: VariableGet [VarName=Health]
NODE n6: RandomFloat [Min=1, Max=20]
NODE n7: SubtractFloat
NODE n8: VariableSet [VarName=Health]
NODE n9: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA n3.Value -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n2.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n8.Execute
DATA n5.Value -> n7.A [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.B [Float]
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.Value [Float]
EXEC n8.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n8.Value -> n9.InString [String]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Damageable
PARENT: Actor
VAR Health: Float = 100
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Health]
NODE n3: GreaterThan [B=0]
NODE n4: WhileLoop
NODE n5: RandomFloat [Min=1, Max=20]
NODE n6: SubtractFloat
NODE n7: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n4.LoopBody -> n6.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n6.A [Float]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.B [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.InString [String] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint with actor array Targets. Loop through finding the closest one. Print the closest actor name.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_FindClosest
PARENT: Actor
VAR Targets: Array<Actor>
VAR ClosestDist: Float = 999999.0
VAR ClosestActor: Actor = None
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Targets]
NODE n3: ForEachLoop
NODE n4: GetDistanceTo
NODE n5: VariableGet [VarName=ClosestDist]
NODE n6: LessThan
NODE n7: Branch
NODE n8: VariableSet [VarName=ClosestDist]
NODE n9: VariableSet [VarName=ClosestActor]
NODE n10: VariableGet [VarName=ClosestActor]
NODE n11: GetDisplayName
NODE n12: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n7.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n6.A [Float]
DATA n5.Value -> n6.B [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n7.True -> n8.Execute
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n8.Value [Float]
EXEC n8.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n9.Value [Actor]
EXEC n3.Completed -> n12.Execute
DATA n10.Value -> n11.Target [Actor]
DATA n11.ReturnValue -> n12.InString [String]
actual_dsl:

NODE n8: GetDisplayName
NODE n9: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n6.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.A [Float]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n6.True -> n7.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n7.Value [Actor]
EXEC n7.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n7.Value -> n8.Target [Actor]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.InString [String] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay runs ForLoop 0 to 9. Prints the index. After completion prints Total: 10 and destroys self.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CountAndDestroy
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=9]
NODE n3: PrintString
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Total: 10"]
NODE n5: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.InString [String]
EXEC n2.Completed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_LoopDestroyer
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=9]
NODE n3: PrintString
NODE n4: VariableGet [VarName=Total]
NODE n5: Concatenate [A="Total: ", B=10]
NODE n6: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.InString [String]
EXEC n2.Completed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.DestroyActor [Actor] }

PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=9]
NODE n3: PrintString

NODE n6: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.InString [String]
EXEC n2.Completed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.DestroyActor [Actor] }
